title.rendered: Financial Commission Announces Execution Quality Certification of Juno Markets

content.rendered:
October 15,  2018, The Financial Commission, a leading independent member-driven external dispute resolution (EDR) organization for international online brokerages that participate in global foreign exchange (forex), derivatives, and CFD markets, today announces execution certification for Juno Markets, a Category A member using Verify My Trade, a recently launched “value-added” service.

Verified order execution quality

Following the launch of order execution verification with Verify My Trade (VMT) in September of this year, Financial Commission broker members continue to apply for certification of their order execution quality as a step to increase transparency regarding execution speed and pricing.

Today, Juno Markets becomes the latest Financial Commission member to have successfully completed the VMT certification, having satisfied all execution quality standards set out for all members of the Commission. To become certified, Juno Markets is required to submit 5000 trades per month to be compared against a benchmark of other brokers and liquidity providers. Trade execution must at least meet the benchmark average to receive certification. Traders can now view the execution audit results for Juno Markets directly on our website, by clicking here.

Check your broker’s status

All interested parties can now view the execution audit results for all members of the Financial Commission by visiting our Members page or the profile pages of brokers listed in our Members section. Certified brokers will be highlighted with a unique badge as displayed below.

Check your broker’s status

All interested parties can now view the execution audit results for all members of the Financial Commission by visiting our Members page or the profile pages of brokers listed in our Members section. Certified brokers will be highlighted with a unique badge as displayed below.

 

            

 

By clicking on the badge users will navigate to a dedicated webpage for each broker that will indicate the last time an audit was performed, how many orders were analyzed and whether the results satisfied the order execution standards established by VMT.

If you are interested in using the VMT service or would like more information, please reach out to us at info@financialcommission.org.
